text.0: one half of day is dark and bright the other both atmospheres move on by sage devices.
text.1: agni vaiśvānara when born as sovran hath with his lustre overcome the darkness.
text.2: i know not either warp or woof i know not the web they weave when moving to the contest.
text.3: whose son shall here speak words that must be spoken without assistance from the father near him.
text.4: for both the warp and woof he understandeth and in due time shall speak what should be spoken.
text.5: who knoweth as the immortal worlds protector descending seeing with no aid from other.
text.6: he is the priest the first of all behold him mid mortal men he is the light immortal.
text.7: here was he born firmseated in his station immortal ever waxing in his body.
text.8: a firm light hath been set for men to look on among all things that fly the mind is swiftest.
text.9: all gods of one accord with one intention move unobstructed to a single purpose.
text.10: mine ears unclose to hear mine eye to see him the light that harbours in my spirit broadens.
text.11: far roams my mind whose thoughts are in the distance what shall i speak what shall i now imagine.
text.12: all the gods bowed them down in fear before thee agni when thou wast dwelling in the darkness.
text.13: vaiśvānara be gracious to assist us may the immortal favour us and help us.
